name: Maligoud
description:
Gold nuggets were the mansa's exclusive property, and trading them within his bounds was banned. All gold was promptly turned over to the imperial treasury in exchange for gold dust of equal value. Since the period of the Ghana Empire, gold dust had been weighed and packed for use. Because the drug was so prevalent in the region, Mali adapted the practice to combat inflation. The confusing mithqal was the most prevalent gold measurement inside the realm (4.5 grams of gold). Although it is unknown whether the empire employed coined currency, this phrase was used interchangeably with dinar. Gold dust was employed throughout the empire, but not all regions valued it equally.

3000x3000
